description:
We Are:
  Accenture has the largest SuccessFactors services practice and one of the highest numbers of certified consultants. Additionally, it is the oldest SAP SuccessFactors partner and has the most experience. Our proprietary Intelligent Enterprise Solution for Talent and HR includes continually updated functional and industry best practices that helps lead our clients to big wins. Our clients commend us for our strong partnership focus and commitment to their success. We also bring the “New” to life using design thinking, agile development methodologies, and the latest smart tech for SAP when it comes to automation and AI. You will get the chance to work in our fast growing and dynamic Canadian practice, with a wide range of top clients across all industries.
 
  You Are:
  A transformation maven with the skills to help clients meet the challenges of digitization. Your human superpower? Using your know-how, creativity, and analytical powers to solve clients’ most complex business problems to help their companies do more. You’re comfortable diving into the details of workstreams and identifying the target technical and landscape architecture. Additionally, you have the communication and people skills to inspire team members to bring their A-game.  The Work:
 
   Work with clients to understand their business needs and requirements, and provide expert guidance on the design and implementation of SAP SuccessFactors solutions
   Translate technical concepts into functional client-facing language, both verbally and in written format
   Develop solution architecture and design documents that align with client needs and business objectives
   Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver successful implementations of SAP SuccessFactors solutions through integrations with other systems
   Perform quality assurance and testing on solutions to ensure they meet client requirements and are operating effectively
   Provide technical expertise and support to clients during and after the implementation process
   Keep up to date with the latest trends and best practices in SAP SuccessFactors and related technologies, and proactively share knowledge with the team and clients
   You’ve got experience executing and supporting testing phases and defect management
   Travel is required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 40-70% depending on the project phase and/or client requirements.
 

 
 

 Here’s what you need:
 
   Minimum 4 years of SAP transformation, technical advisory or consulting experience
   Minimum 2 years working with SuccessFactors to SAP integrations (replication, P2P, etc.)
   Minimum 2 years of experience in coordinating the completion of project deliverables, e.g. Functional and Technical specifications documents, etc.
   SAP SuccessFactors certification in Employee Central
   Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
   You’re certified in SAP SuccessFactors Core Hybrid
   Must have strong understanding of Integrations to and from SuccessFactors and strong knowledge of CPI
 
 
  Bonus points if:
 
   You’re certified more than one additional SuccessFactors modules (Recruitment Management, Learning Management, Compensation, Performance & Goals, Succession)
   You have experience configuring replication to SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll
 
 
  What´s in it for you:
 
   Competitive benefits, including a fair and balanced parental leave policy.
   Fantastic opportunities to develop your career across industries with local and global clients.
   Performance achievement and career mentorship: our performance management process focuses on your strengths, progress and career possibilities.
   Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to charity work.
 
 
  #LI-NA
  #LI-MP
 
  Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation, based on full-time employment, for roles that may be hired in British Columbia as set forth below.
  Information on benefits is here.
  Role Location Annual Salary Range
  British Columbia $73,300 to $155,000
